sections.title: Market Pulse: Tech Rebound Continues, Economic Data Awaited

items.headline: US Equities Extend Gains on Tech Strength; Caution Ahead of Key Data
items.summary: US stock markets closed higher on Monday, extending a rebound led by technology stocks, as investors cautiously await a week packed with crucial economic data. The Dow Jones Industrial Average reached a fresh record high. Overall market sentiment remains a mix of optimism over broadening gains and apprehension regarding upcoming inflation and employment figures, which are expected to guide Federal Reserve policy. Pre-market indications for Tuesday suggest a more modest start following yesterday's strong performance. Not financial advice.

sections.title: Major Indices Performance (as of Feb 9, 2026, close)

items.headline: Oracle Surges on AI Optimism
items.summary: Oracle shares jumped after an analyst upgrade, fueled by optimism surrounding artificial intelligence demand.

items.headline: Nvidia Leads Chipmaker Rally
items.summary: Chipmaker Nvidia continued its rebound, extending gains and reinforcing confidence in AI-linked investments.

items.headline: Workday Slides on CEO Change
items.summary: Workday fell after the AI platform announced CEO Carl Eschenbach is stepping down, with co-founder Aneel Bhusri returning as chief executive.

items.headline: Merck Among Monday's Laggards
items.summary: Merck was one of the top decliners among major US stocks in Monday's trading session.

items.headline: Sector Dynamics: Tech Rebounds, Energy and Staples Remain Strong
items.summary: While the technology sector experienced a significant rebound on Monday after a recent sell-off driven by AI concerns, other sectors such as Energy, Materials, Consumer Staples, and Industrials have shown sustained strength. Investors are observing a rotation of capital into these value and cyclical-oriented sectors.

items.headline: Key Companies Report Earnings Today
items.summary: Several major companies are scheduled to report earnings today, February 10, 2026, before market open. These include Coca-Cola ($KO), S&P Global ($SPGI), CVS Health ($CVS), Duke Energy ($DUK), Marriott International ($MAR), Spotify Technology ($SPOT), Ecolab ($ECL), Ferrari ($RACE), Datadog ($DDOG), Xylem ($XYL), Fiserv ($FISV), BP ($BP), and Ford Motor ($F). Goodyear ($GT) will also host an investor call following its Q4 and full-year 2025 results.

items.headline: Economic Data Releases and Upcoming Fed Watch
items.summary: Today, the US is set to release the Employment Cost Index and Trade Price Indices at 8:30 AM ET. Looking ahead, the highly anticipated January jobs report (Non-farm payrolls) is due on Wednesday, February 11, and January CPI inflation figures on Friday, February 13. These reports will be critical in shaping expectations for the Federal Reserve's interest rate policy for the remainder of 2026, after the Fed maintained rates at 3.5%-3.75% following its January meeting.

items.headline: AI Investment Boom Continues to Drive Market Narratives
items.summary: The AI investment boom continues to be a significant macro trend, driving strong performance in chipmakers and select technology stocks. However, concerns persist regarding the impact of rapidly advancing AI tools on traditional software business models, leading to volatility in some software companies. Singapore, for instance, has upgraded its economic growth forecast for 2026, citing a boom in demand for AI-related products.
